function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Development of ontologies for infectious diseases surveillance and diagnosis","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Multilingual ontology for surveillance of infectious diseases","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Transformation of ontologies health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of ontologies to model disease aspects can lead to unintentional release of sensitive information","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Integration of ontologies and query interfaces could lead to unintended exposure of disease-related data","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Development of infectious disease ontologies for modeling different types of diseases.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of social media data for infectious disease surveillance and monitoring.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Utilization of web-based tools for visualizing spatial-temporal disease spread.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of covid-19 ontology for surveillance activities","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Text mining approaches and semantic interoperability using covid-19 ontology","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Development of covid-19 ontology for cases and patients information codo","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Development of codo ontology without expert input or validation","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Importing data from an unreliable or inaccurate source","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate security measures for the exported ontology data","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Development of new drugs and antibodies may not cover all variations of the human coronavirus, leading to gaps in treatment options.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Synchronous development of ontologies with the appearance of new diseases may lead to gaps in coverage and understanding of specific disease aspects.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dependency on existing ontologies and integration of terms from multiple sources may introduce inconsistencies and errors in the cido risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of thorough testing and validation of ontology development tools","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Diffusion of pandemics ontologies through various websites may lead to the spread of incorrect or incomplete information.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited evaluation of developed ontologies using only description logic dl queries may result in incomplete validation of the ontologies.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of a comprehensive ontology that models multiple similar diseases may hinder the effective sharing of knowledge and development of vaccines and drugs for emerging pandemics.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of adoption of biomedical application ontologies","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inadequate development of new risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exposure to uv-c radiation from the surfacide system","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Handling of dried virus and potential risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Testing mers-cov sensitivity to uv-c under strict containment bsl3 laboratory protocols","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Moist environment created by bleach-soaked pads preventing drying of virus onto glass coverslips","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Plaque counts indicating reduction of risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient uv-c irradiation doses to inactivate sars-cov-2 virions in respiratory droplets","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unproven effectiveness of upper-room uvgi in inactivating sars-cov-2 virions in the air","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The
